newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia not a bidder in Saudi barley tender.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia not a bidder in Saudi barley tender.

text.p: Australia had not bid in a Saudi Arabian tender for 800,000 tonnes of feed barley and expected the sale would have gone mainly to the European Union, a spokesman for the Australian Barley Board told Reuters.
Saudi Arabia was looking for 800,000 tonnes in a tender which closed on August 21, he said from Adelaide.
With the tender for September/October arrival, there was no spare feed barley in Australia at present, he said.
Because of the size of the latest Saudi tender, several countries were be expected to have won it.
Confirmation was expected in the next day or two, he said.
"We were anticipating a couple of cargoes from Canada, a couple from the U.S., but most of it from Europe, mostly Germany," he said.
Australia would bid in the next Saudi tender, probably for December/January delivery, he said.
The harvest of new crop 1996/97 barley would by then be well under way.
